subject: Physical Fitness
title: Shoulder Impingement
description: A short lesson to help you apply Shoulder Impingement.

hook.text: Lift your arm overhead and feel a pinch? That could be shoulder impingement â€” the most common shoulder complaint.

buildup.text: Impingement describes tissues getting compressed in the shoulder's subacromial space during overhead movement.

discovery.text: It's often caused by poor scapular control. The shoulder blade doesn't rotate properly, narrowing the space.

twist.text: Bench pressing and overhead pressing with poor technique are the most common gym-related causes.

climax.text: Strengthening rotator cuff muscles and improving scapular mechanics resolves most cases without surgery.

punchline.text: Impingement is a movement problem. Fix the movement and the pain resolves.

quiz.question: What is the primary cause of shoulder impingement during exercise?
options: Poor scapular control narrowing the subacromial space
